cause.description: Neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF-2) is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder that causes tumors to form on the nerves of the central nervous system, in the brain, and on the spine. It affects one in 33,000-40,000 males and females of all races and ethnic groups. The NF-2 gene is located on chromosome 22.
cause.name: Neurofibromatosis type 2
